boardgame.name: The Swamp Hag's House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perhaps the rumours that she's a hag are untrue, and that she's really just a reclusive healer. Or maybe there's no smoke without fire...

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a bleak swamp, with giant trees, and a ramshackle hut. Interiors show the inside of the hut, a secret hag room inside the tree, a secret underground prison, and an escape route into a nearby hollow tree.

boardgame.name: The Giant Husk
The Giant Husk Part 1
The Giant Husk Part 1 of 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The giant husk is an enormous centaurian golem, constructed centuries ago from masses of undead flesh by the wizard Drakdagor, and it disappeared when he did. Writers of arcane histories have mostly assumed that he took it with him when he left , and rode it to some far-off plane of existence, mainly for want of any other explanation. Though some were ready to believe it consigned to the dustbin of history, there is no hope for that now. The husk has recently be seen again, lumbering across the Sakhab Wastes. It has been known by many names—the undead colossus, the pyramid of pain, and the chariot of Drakdagar, among others. But the dark elf wizards all know it is hollow, and are not afraid to say so, with the result being that most wastelanders follow their lead if and when they ever speak of it. Human adventurers, as usual, are the last to know. Some Western historians who recognize this rotting mountain even believe it heralds the return of its missing creator, unwelcome as he might be in this day and age.

But there has been no sign of that malevolent genius. The goblins suspect it is instead controlled by some pyromancer or other, as it is now full of fire, which it can breathe upon its foes. Th e orcs have faced this thing in battle once before, and only the most danger-loving giantslayers would like to do so again (especially since it does not, so far, threaten their expansionist designs). But they would still like to know what its purpose is, at the very least.

For the giant husk has not besieged any settlements. Not yet, anyway. Nomads, merchants, and travellers have all gone missing at times when, and places where, the husk has been sighted. And there are those who say they have escaped a violent encounter with the giant, and perhaps a wizard who accompanies it. One group of adventurers found a piece of evidence in the wake of the husk — an ancient Ardoussarlian shrine, dug up from the earth and looted. But they knew not what, exactly, was looted from this excavation. Clearly, this lumbering beast is up to no good, but no one yet knows what it searches for in these blighted wastelands.

boardgame.name: Eldregan the Astrologist
The Giant Husk Part 2
The Giant Husk Part 2 of 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eldregan grew up in the heart of the Great Western Empire, a sickly boy born into an ancient noble family. From an early age, he showed a talent for book learning, and little else, so his family pushed him to enter the Imperial College of Wizardry as early as possible. He was thrust into a world of petty rivalries and bureaucratic conspiracies while still an
impressionable youth, and tasked with mastering a host of dangerous spells. Seeing his peers burn out dramatically — and sometimes literally — made him cautious and hardworking, and yet he did not escape those early days at college unscathed.

When he spent too much time “helping” his fellow students with their lab work, in order to be accepted, the close contact with alchemicals accentuated the deformities he was born with to comical proportions. Instead of gratitude, his peers only increased their bullying, leaving Eldregan with deep psychological scars.

boardgame.name: Outer Rim Themes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the Rim!

These character themes are ideal for characters whose roots are in the grungy frontiers of interstellar civilization, the no-nonsense moisture farmers, free traders, rough-and-tumble miners, and hard-luck homesteaders that dot the sparsely populated reaches of the galaxy. Wherever the bright center of the universe is, their homeworlds are the planets farthest from it, and to tell the truth they kind of like it that way. Play a asteroid belt raider, a grunge-tinker salvager, a mineral-hungry stellar prospector, or a tough-as-nails wastelander and show those soft dilettantes from so-called "civilized systems" how it's done!

boardgame.name: The Size-Changer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Keep it Simple: Size-Changer
Simple classes are trimmed-down, streamlined classes designed to be easy to pick up and play for both new players and system veterans! Each has a sleek core set of abilities that isn’t bogged down with options backed up with a strong but balanced chassis (HD, saves, BAB, etc).

Size-Changer (Pathfinder 1st Editon)
Size-changers have supernatural control over their size and density; this allows them to both shrink and grow at their whims. Grow to the size of a cottage or shrink to the size of a pixie; the power is yours!

boardgame.name: 20 Vile Vapors (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Toxic gas is one of the most common hazards faced by explorers of sewers, dungeons, and other subterranean spaces. Some of these foul vapors are naturally occurring, while others are the byproducts of magical catastrophes, alchemical experiments gone awry, or interdimensional incursions into the mortal plane. Assassins and tyrants alike often weaponize such gases to subjugate or terrorize those who oppose them.

20 Vile Vapors presents twenty rare and unusual vapors to terrorize your players, including ghoul fog, lavender reek, and stygian dioxide. These gasses that dissolve memories, transform flesh to copper, or grant mind-bending visions.

Plus it includes a new spell Niznoc's exhalation, which lets players harness the vapors from this book.

boardgame.name: Nice to Meet You
boardgame.description:
"Which animal card best represents me?"
The answer you believe may not be the same one your friends think. Get to know your old friends - and new aquaintances - with a game that can bring an entirely new understanding to the way you view yourself and others.

How to play and how to win the game: Each player will have a same set of animal cards. The players take turns to draw a question card, choose one question from the card and all the players will answer that question with an animal card of their choice. Don't let the others players see which card you chose and reveal the cards at the same time. If you played the same animal card as the host (the player who drew the card), you can get a point. Talk about why you chose this card, if the host wants, they can choose a Best Answer player and give them another point. At the end of the game, the players with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Dancing on Needle Tips
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The special backer adventure from GenCon 2019. Decide the fate of the Paris Hardpoint, and potentially drive a wedge between The Church and their most powerful minions! What will your Storm Knights choose?

boardgame.name: QUILL.exe: Transmissions from the Black
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

>>RECEIVING TRANSMISSION...

QUILL.exe: Transmissions from the Black presents an alternative science fiction setting for Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player, wherein the characters are typing up transmissions to send from their deep space exploration/colony vessel. When used with the basic rules from Quill, this supplement provides six new characters, three new skills, and four new scenarios.

Take on the role of a Diplomat, Stowaway, Artificial Intelligence, Colonist, Engineer, or Captain! Plead with a recalcitrant Supply Officer, make First Contact with an alien vessel, negotiate with a Colony that you might call home, and leave a message of warning and hope to future explorers! Boost your signal strength, pick a subroutine to help you write, and start typing so that you can send your transmission across the void between stars.

Hopefully it gets a warm reception.
boardgame.rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player

boardgame.name: Template: Undead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dragged back to life from death, or perhaps undergoing some sort of unspeakable transformation, the Hero or Villain has become one of the Undead. That is to say a lifeless corpse that is somehow inexplicably still moving. Many forms of undeath are a terrible curse, such as vampirism or the transformation into a zombie, that leaves the character with a thirst for blood or hunger for flesh. Other Heroes or Villains can become terrible wraiths, ghosts or other forms of unliving eternal. This PDF contains everything you need to add this new template inspired from DC Comics Looker and Secret and Marvel Comics Baron Blood and Morbius to your Superhero genre game store and local home Super-Powered by M&M games.

boardgame.name: Pumpkind, PumpKnight, Pumpking
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pumpkind, pumpknight, pumpking is an adventure designed for a party of four to six 3rdlevel characters. The adventure starts in the small village of Almes, near pumpkin harvesting season. The people of Almes depend on their pumpkin harvest to get through the winter season, but much to the dismay of the villagers, their pumpkins have been disappearing from their fields.

boardgame.name: Horrors of the Heights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Himmilgard is a land of a great many dangers, few which are well understood. Some are simple for humans to comprehend: a Grand Eagle will swoop in and tear apart your plane because it is hungry. Others are strange, but their boundaries are known: if you wish to avoid the Fae, don’t stray into the Wild. But in the darkest forests, the deepest caves, and the open ocean are a myriad of dangerous creatures which exist at the level of rumours, half-remembered stories, and blurry photographs.

High up in the clouds, too, there are dangers.

As the combustion engine has grown more powerful, the airplane and airship swifter and more reliable, people have edged ever closer to this strange realm, ignorant of that which lurks above. For the open air is not as empty as it seems, and that which lurks at these great heights is inimical and alien to human life. While the shape of this threat is known to few, veteran pilots know better than to stray too far from the safety and certainty of solid earth.

Flying Circus: Horror of the Heights is a 44 page expansion for Flying Circus, expanding the game's support for high altitude gameplay both in the air and on the ground.

This book contains...

Expanded rules for high altitudes and extreme conditions, including the effects of changing temperatures with altitude.
Rules for turning high altitude gameplay into a maze of terrifying monsters!
Special rules for alpine travel on foot and making camp in the harsh wilderness.
New character moves and traits for fighting high in the air.
New equipment like oxygen tanks and escape balloons, new weapons including sniper rifles and ice axes, and new aircraft modifications like oxidized fuel and lightning-dispersion systems!
A variety of new high-altitude threats, like the hypnotic Mimic Moth, the mysterious Flying Fortresses, and the malevolent Lightning Sprites. Also includes revamps, examples, and expansions to Leviathans, Sky Screamers, and Cloud Jellies.
Six new aircraft optimized for high altitude work, from the Markgraf Totengräber zeppelin-hunter to the Sonnenjäger Hummel spy plane.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #24 - Dec 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #24:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages

Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

boardgame.name: Trigon
boardgame.description:
Trigon is a tile placement game by Wilhelm Kienzle from 1951 and was published by Naef in 1958.
Each player gets a set of 9 similar right triangles (5 different sizes) that form a geometric sequence.
All 9 tiles together form a square with a square hole in which a cube (the die) lies.
A triangle is made up of two smaller ones in the sequence.
The side lengths of the triangle are based on the golden section.

You can find more in the book "Kurt Naef: Der Spielzeugmacher".
All tiles and the box are made of wood in high quality.

The game: A player rolls the die that dertemines a specific size, 6 meaning any choice. The player places the triangle on the table. In turn order, the other players place one of their triangles adjacent to the last played triangle with the same length (similar to the principle of domino). A player who cannot do so must pass. The player who gets rid of all his triangles wins.

In addition, mathematical facts are presented about the Golden section, the theorem of Pythagoras and about parallelograms. There a puzzles presented to be solved as well.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Empire Plateau: The Lateral Thinking Tactical Strategy Wargame
boardgame.description:
Empire Plateau is a BRAND NEW experience for all board game lovers and even more so for the strategically minded and can be played by 2,3 or 4 players at a time. A game for family, friends and lovers of lateral thinking that requires No Dice, No Cards and No Luck!

The theme for the armies have been based on the Four Empires that have ruled the known world at their time; Babylonian, Median Persian, Greek and Roman.

Plan your strategy for Defence and Attack, manoeuvre around the game board, win skirmishes, use skills and tactics for area control and eventually claim Victory by conquering your opponents Empires base.

boardgame.name: Napoleon's Wars: Wargame Rules 1792 - 1815
boardgame.description:
Napoleon's Wars is an exciting and well designed set of wargame rules for the Napoleonic period.

They allow you to take the role of Generals and re-fight battles in miniature using any scale figures from 2mm to 28mm.
Most importantly, they do not require the use of dice.
The mechanisms used to control your armies encourage you to use the tactics of the period.
The rules pit you very much against your opponent in the combat process.
Everything you need in one book to refight your battles and campaigns including army lists, scenarios and campaign rules.
A Divisional sized battle can be completed within two hours and a Corps level battle within three hours.
The rules are flexible enough to allow players to fight solo, two-player as well as multi-player battles.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hitting Home: Axis Raids on the Soo Locks, 1942 &1945
boardgame.description:
It is not beyond the ingenuity of Hitler’s military schemers to carry bombing planes in sections across the Atlantic by submarine and slip them through the slim cordons of the naval patrols in to the Hudson Bay area. There, on some lonely island, safe from the eyes of all except an occasional Indian, those planes could be assembled and made ready for an attack on the Soo ship canal. —— Lieutenant Colonel Harold A. Furlong, February 1942.

Hitting Home is an introductory level game about Axis raids on the Soo Locks during WWII. The Soo Locks were a crucial choke point for the shipment of all of the iron ore used by US and Canadian steel mills. Air raids by German and Japanese aircraft were planned by all sides.

Although never carried out, strikes against this crucial Home Front installation could have had a profound impact on the war’s outcome. Hitting Home allows players to explore the “what if” of German or Japanese attacks against the Soo Locks.

The 1942 scenario portrays a German attack using disguised merchant ships to transport Heinkel (He) 115 and 114 floatplane bombers to Hudson Bay. There the aircraft would have been unloaded, armed and taken off to attack the Soo Locks about 600 miles to the south and west. Since the range of the He-114 aircraft would be insufficient for the planes to make a return trip back to the transports, it is assumed the planes would have landed in a lake on the return leg and been picked up by the larger He-115 or other floatplanes designated for search and rescue.

The 1945 scenario portrays an attack launched from two Japanese I-400 attack submarines. These massive submarines carried three Aichi M6A bombers in hangers. The bombers were launched from a catapult that ran along the top of the ship’s bow. It is assumed 4 of these bombers would be used in the attack (based on the presumption that it would be very remarkable for all 3 of a submarine’s aircraft to be operational at the same time).

—based on description from the publisher

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Hitting Home by the publisher and designer.
Mounted counters are available for an additional $8.00.
A card set for the game is also available. The card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, feature graphics by the same artist that did the game's, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards. The Hitting Home card set is an additional $10.00
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Monster's Coffee: Lumberjack
boardgame.description:
A single promo card.

Rule:
You have to choose the 5 family you'll be playing with, then add the Lumberjack to the deck, shuffle the cards and distribute 10 to each player.
When you choose this card, place it in the monster family of your choice which already has ate least one monster, in the middle of the table.
This family won't worth any coffee token at the end of the round.
If the lumberjack is in your frontline or your backline at the end of the round, it doesn't count for the coffee token distribution.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster's Coffee

boardgame.name: Monster's Coffee: Poulpomoka
boardgame.description:
When you choose this card, play it on any card located in the frontline of your choice.
Immediatly, you have to use the power of the covered monster.
The covered card can't be chosen anymore and won't count during the cofee distribution.
A covered card remains under the Poulpomoka all along the round, even if this one moves. Thus, sometimes you'll have to move the covered card with the Poupomoka.
When you distribute the coffee tokens at the end of the round, the player who has the most number of Poulpomoka cards will win a number of points that corresponds to the number of covered cards under his Poulpomokas.
Note: If you play with the SNOUT, when a coffee token is placed on the card you want to cover, just take it.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster's Coffee

boardgame.name: The 1879 Anglo Zulu War: A Potted History & Wargames Rules
boardgame.description:
The Zulu War presents an opportunity for a highly colourful wargame between two very contrasting opponents.
The battles that were fought show that whilst there was a certain sense of an inevitable British victory to the war, the Zulu army was certainly capable of inflicting a punishing defeat upon the British given an opportunity to unleash a co-ordinated attack using the classical fighting bull buffalo tactics.

This book comes in two parts.
The first is a potted history of the Zulu War of 1879.
The second is a set of wargame rules best suited to 25mm or 28mm figures.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Number Wonderful
ナンバーワンダフル
boardgame.description:
In Number Wonderful, a.k.a. ナンバーワンダフル, players face all sorts of strange challenges, with each challenge being carried out by the game's current champ and one challenger.

The only way to score points is to be the champ — but the challenger gets to decide which challenge takes place. Will you be competing to see who can name the dish that other players most want to eat right now? Will you each pretend to be sick to see whose illness looks the most real? If the players vote for the champ, the champ scores points, but they keep those points only if they voluntarily step down from their position. If the challenger wins, then the champ loses all of their banked points.

How bold are you feeling, champ?

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Join Muk and his friend Birdsquirrel for their next adventure in Dankwood, as our crafty goblin teams up with the Archmage Tasha to bring you more fun activities and adventure ideas.

For players of all levels.

This activity book, lovingly crafted and illustrated by D&D’s Emi Tanji, includes enjoyable adventure hooks written by D&D’s Adam Lee, puzzles, unique Dankwood critters developed by D&D’s Chris Lindsay! Each page is made to be colored and enjoyed, so let the adventure begin!

boardgame.name: The Dead God's Hand Multi-Pack
boardgame.description:

Wet, dry, and permanent marker erasable.

boardgame.name: You're OK, Boomer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're OK, Boomer is the fourteenth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements."

You're OK, Boomer is a look at Boomers in #iHunt. It's strange, celebratory, dark, and full to the brim with stories waiting to happen.

First off, note the layout. It's our holiday special! It's all ugly sweater themed, in honor of our Boomer ancestors.
We open the book with a massive series of essays about what it's like for Boomers on the hunt, and explaining some of the unique facets of their lives. Every single micro-essay is coupled with a Stunt for players to consider for their Boomer characters.
Then we give you an all-new Kink. It's called Le Dupin, and it's full of Boomers who hunt using their advanced investigative knowledge gleaned from years of procedural mystery shows.
Next, we go through a weird little gig generator. It generates sappy, cheesy holiday TV special style stories, but with an #iHunt twist!
We close out with four new monsters related to the rest of the book's content.

boardgame.name: The World of Vampire Hunter D
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

The Year is 12,090 AD

Vampires rule the night, but their numbers are dwindling. With huge bounties on vampires' heads, a class of hunters has emerged. One hunter is unlike the others. He is a dhampir - half human, half vampire. At war with himself, feared by all, tortured and alone, he is Vampire Hunter D.

Explore the gothic frontier of Vampire Hunter D, a distant future where vampire overlords terrorize humanity's remnants with occultism and super=science. Inspired by the works of Hideyuki Kikuchi and Vampire Hunter D: Message from Mars from Stranger Comics, The World of Vampire Hunter D brings the boundless horrors of 12,090 AD to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Inside this accessory, you'll find:


A new Pathfinder RPG class, the vampire hunter, providing you with everything you need to strike fear into the still hearts of the undead.



New archetypes, feats, and other character option, including detail on how to gain your own parasitic companion akin to D's unsettling ally, Left Hand.



Gear, magic items, and powerful artifacts from 12,090 AD, including technological marvels and D's mysterious azure pendant.



Details on the threats and inhabitants of Vampire Hunter D's world, including dhampirs, mutants, and an entirely new strain of vampire.



A brief adventure for vampire-hunting heroes, "Requiem for Fallen Stars."



Statistics for Vampire Hunter D himself, along with tips for roleplaying and customizing this legendary hero.

boardgame.name: 北斗の拳 世紀末断末魔遊戯 (Fist of the North Star)
boardgame.description: 北斗の拳 世紀末断末魔遊戯 (Fist of the North Star) is a real-time party game that contains two game modes.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday February, 2020 - Session 0: Teens in Space
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Though games of Icarus can stand on their own, they can also serve as an interesting and exciting way to collaboratively create the backstory of a certain location within a longer campaign of another game. Today, we’re going to look at how to use Icarus to shape the rumored history of a planet, moon, or space colony you might encounter in a game of Teens in Space, as well as provide a few setting suggestions to get you off and running.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday March, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Beneath the surface of the ocean, the people of Icarus found a new frontier to explore. With the lands of earth massively overpopulated, these new pioneers settled on the miles of open aquatic land below and built the bones of a new city- one where nature and humanity could cohabitate better than the earth above. Over thousands of years, some of their bodies adapted to this environment, evolving lungs that could process water as well as they could air, and webbed fingers and toes. This small but vital evolutionary change was the catalyst for the massive growth of Icarus, a thriving city that now reaches its tentacles wide across the ocean floor.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday April, 2020
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A thousand years ago, the Great Flood was said to have swallowed up all of the land left on the Earth’s surface. Civilization’s infrastructure as we know it was lost to the sea, the only reminder of its ambition lying in the great spires that push up from the depths of the ocean, structures the drydwellers once called skyscrapers. But humanity rebuilt, this time atop the endless blue. From the twisted wreckage of the Old World, our ancestors made new homes on metal islands and ship colonies-- but none were as grand as the massive atoll of Icarus. A miracle feat of science and engineering, the city has grown from a place of refuge and safety to a place of envious luxury in an otherwise hostile world.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday May, 2020 - Session 0: Outbreak: Undead...
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Though games of Icarus can stand on their own, they can also serve as an interesting and exciting way to collaboratively create the backstory of a certain location within a longer campaign of another game. Today, we’re going to look at how to use Icarus to shape the setting of your Outbreak: Undead.. campaign, as well as provide a few setting suggestions to get you off and running.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday June, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Established first as a sprawling prison colony shot up to Mars in hopes of using the prisoners to build a decadent city for the richest of Earth’s population, the terrible storms and brutal temperature fluctuations on the planet eventually led to the project being scrapped altogether, and the prisoners being abandoned there. But they continued to build and terraform. Finally, despite hundreds of years of isolation from Earth, the city of Icarus has been transformed into a massive futuristic frontier town hailed as the new Wild West.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday July, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Powered by the constant, low rumble of engines deep within the heart of the city, Icarus plods along its continental path to the steady ticking of thousands of pieces of clockwork. With an amalgamation of stone walls and great bronze spires, all of the citizens within are in a state of constant motion.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday August, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Icarus is alive. Having taken shelter on the back of a massive winged creature during one of their thousand year slumbers, the people of Icarus were thrust into the air upon its reawakening and now soar above the dangerous world below. With the privacy and protection of this flying foundation, the city has thrived like no other place in this region has been able to.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday September, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

So much has changed, and it hasn’t even been a week since the animals of Icarus Farm overthrew their human oppressors. After chasing the humans off of the farm, they quickly installed what they were sure would be the perfect system of government. Now, they will need to prove the perfection of their great experiment to the surrounding farms and nearby villages. They will need to show the world what the animals of Icarus Farm can do.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday October, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Following the Second World War, the rural nations of Eastern Europe were torn apart by the recent conflict. Years later, after harvesting the charred skeletons of the ruined machines of war and learning of new engineering techniques, the founders of the new city or Icarus rose to conquer the heavens with towering walls, buildings and machines. The industrial revolution had reached Icarus in a staggering explosion of manufacture and new progress. The city itself, an organism of iron and smoke, now rivals any technological marvel of engineering from around the globe.

boardgame.name: Icarus Free Content Friday November, 2020 - Setting Suggestion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a timeline different to our own, the land of dinosaurs was never destroyed, they continued to roam the planet and formed a reluctant coexistence with early humans. The might and size of the dinosaurs combined with the brains and network of humans have created a utopian city within the prehistoric jungles. This city of Icarus is now home to humans and dinosaurs, working together to build machines and contraptions neither would be able to create alone. Survival in this hostile land is difficult, but with an expansive system of communication, the support of their titanic prehistoric beasts, and the power of new industrial contraptions, the citizens of Icarus have proven to be a beacon to the disparate members of humanity. No amount of carnivorous monsters from outside of the city can bring down its majesty.

boardgame.name: Portrait Workshop
PortraitWorks
boardgame.description:
Portrait Workshop is a mobile app for iPhone, iPad, and Android devices that makes it easy to create beautiful customized character portraits. You can bring your own character to life in less than a minute - no art skills required!

Portrait Workshop is not a library of pre-drawn portraits. Instead, it creates unique portraits from professionally hand-illustrated weapons, armor, gear, clothing, and facial features. All of those elements can be selected and combined across nearly all of the artwork, including artwork from the stretch goals.

As a result, you can make millions of portraits without seeing the same one twice.

The simple interface is fun and easy to use. Select your character’s traits (age, gender, race, class, and beauty), and then multiple portraits appear. Pick one you like as a starting point, and fine-tune it until it matches your vision of your character.

You can even export portraits directly into World Anvil — one of the world’s best campaign management tools — to add more personality to your character or your campaign.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Kids on Bikes Free Content Friday February, 2020 - Something Weird this Way Comes: Dunsinane High School
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dunsinane, Kentucky is a small community with a smaller high school and an even smaller theater community. So small that it’s not uncommon for Chet Barker, the school’s enthusiastic football coach and reluctant director, to strongarm his football players into taking roles in the play. It’s during the off-season anyway, right?

boardgame.name: Quest Decks: The Notice Board
boardgame.description:
Enhance your tabletop adventures with Quest Decks. Each deck contains 45 quest prompts in the form of posted notices that adventurers might find on their journeys. Game Masters can use these decks to create notice boards full of side quests for players to explore: simply draw cards from the Quest Deck as your adventurers enter a settlement, or select specific cards from the deck to use in your specialized setting! Mix and match decks to add even more encounters.

---- The Notice Board ----
Filled with traditional quests a party may find in a fantasy town.

boardgame.name: Quest Decks: For The Crown
boardgame.description:
Enhance your tabletop adventures with Quest Decks. Each deck contains 45 quest prompts in the form of posted notices that adventurers might find on their journeys. Game Masters can use these decks to create notice boards full of side quests for players to explore: simply draw cards from the Quest Deck as your adventurers enter a settlement, or select specific cards from the deck to use in your specialized setting! Mix and match decks to add even more encounters.

---- For The Crown ----
Plunges your character into a world of nobles and intrigue. A chance at bigger rewards, but with higher stakes.

boardgame.name: Kids on Bikes Free Content Friday March, 2020 - Parents & Kids on Bikes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Role Playing Games (RPGs) have been a stable source of entertainment for over 40 years. It is a hobby that connects people, of varying ages and professions, in the pursuit of fun and collaborative storytelling. This unique form of gaming is all about creating characters and running them through various adventures. Role playing stimulates creativity, problem solving, and provides opportunities for development of social skills. Educators and therapists are using role playing games to teach and heal. This short guide is designed for parents to enable them to use Kids on Bikes for more than just entertainment.

boardgame.name: Quest Decks: Into The Stars
boardgame.description:
Enhance your tabletop adventures with Quest Decks. Each deck contains 45 quest prompts in the form of posted notices that adventurers might find on their journeys. Game Masters can use these decks to create notice boards full of side quests for players to explore: simply draw cards from the Quest Deck as your adventurers enter a settlement, or select specific cards from the deck to use in your specialized setting! Mix and match decks to add even more encounters.

---- Into The Stars ----
This sci-fi themed deck will take your players on Interstellar adventures. Designed to work great for space-fairing games such as Stars without Number and Starfinder.

boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Are you ready for your Happily Ever After? Benjamin Tower is your fairytale retirement come true. It is redefining senior living and provides a retirement solution for you or the loved ones in your life. Our facility is designed to care for every level of need that you may have.

boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hello Pupper! You are a good dog who lives with a wonderful human family in an exciting, big town, known as Agloe, New York.

boardgame.name: Kids on Bikes Free Content Friday August, 2020 - Anacondas on Airliners
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome! Bienvenidos! Willkommen! Thank you for flying Serpentine Airlines.

boardgame.name: Kids on Brooms Free Content Friday October, 2020
boardgame.description:
An extract from Professor Bharadwy's Book of Beasts

From the introduction:

Having journeyed the world over and seen countless wondrous creatures, I decided to write this tome to explain what to expect when venturing into the unexpected. In this volume, I’ll tell you about what you might expect if you encounter a mythical beast, what to do in the terrifying circumstance that you come into conflict with something far scarier than you, and how to record information about any new species you might find.

boardgame.name: Kids on Bikes Free Content Friday November, 2020 - Skull & Bikes Society, New Haven, CT
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A smaller city at the end of the New York City commuter train line, New Haven exists at the far edge of the enormous shadow cast by the capital of the world. To some, it’s a sleepy old college town, the home of Yale University with all its libraries, research facilities, and colonial charm. To others it’s a hectic mess of asphalt, failed “urban renewal”, and too many people. To the kids of the city, it’s all that and more.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - February 2020: The Infested
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One of the most bizarre symbiotic relationships ever witnessed among the undead has been the Infested, these are zombies that are carriers of not only the zombie virus, but of other, smaller creatures that take residence inside their bodily cavities. The size and threat these zombies pose varies tremendously by the zombie’s size and how many creatures that live inside it. It is assumed that these zombies were created when a body being feasted upon reanimated with the vermin still inside it. Instead of fleeing, they take advantage of the situation by swarming out and attacking the same target the zombie attacks, and collectively feast upon the remains. The swarms of rats and flies that live inside them can be seen writhing just beneath the surface of the skin.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - March 2020: The Slasher
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Before the fall of society, the man behind the mask now known simply as ‘The Slasher’ could have been any number of people. Either due to prolonged psychological trauma, a natural proclivity to murder, or some other reason he has now become the personification of one of our most fundamental modern fears. A man who knows no remorse and cannot be reasoned with, a soulless killing machine fueled by the misery and suffering of his victims. Taking up a deathly visage and implement of death, he stakes claim to a territory in which he stalks and slaughters his unsuspecting prey. The undead simply cannot sate his bloodlust, and woe to any who mistakenly find their way onto his hunting grounds.

boardgame.name: Unstable Unicorns: Christmas Special Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Unstable Unicorns Christmas Special Expansion Pack is designed to be added to your Unstable Unicorns Card Game (or Unstable Unicorns NSFW Card Game).

This pack includes holiday-themed characters, magic cards, upgrades, and downgrades.

Unstable Unicorns is a strategic card game that will destroy your friendships...but in a good way.

Contains 36 cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Unstable Unicorns
Unstable Unicorns: NSFW Pack

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - April 2020: The Old Man and the Z
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This focuses on the use of a unique non-player character: a sea captain of a small sailboat who has found a niche as a ferryman and a supplier of fish to mainland vendors. His own story is much deeper than this. His own drama can become intertwined with that of the player characters.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - May 2020: We're All About Family
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s been ten years since the Fall. The Outbreak that lead to the end of society as we know it. Ten years since all resources that were once easily available became scarce. And one of the scarcest resources of all is family.

Whether it be to Infected, starvation, hopelessness, or a myriad of other causes, everyone has lost someone since the Fall. As much as these circumstances dig deep into the hearts of many, the idea of bringing another life, another mouth to feed, into this desolate life seems optimistically foolish at best and desperately dangerous at worst. However, life finds a way and the future of our new world grows with each passing day.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - June 2020: Outbreak at Echidna Ridge
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s a grey, cloudy afternoon, but the rain has held off so far over the Echidna Ridge Wildlife Sanctuary, meaning that the tourists and school groups roaming the winding paths that divide the Sanctuary into its various regions are chilly but dry. Some of the animals are indifferent to the weather: the swans and ibises are content on their lake, and the platypus exhibit is always comfortable for its inhabitants. The wombats, nocturnal, are if anything more awake in the dull light, shifting in their burrows behind the glass. High in the gum trees, koalas munch on leaves and look placidly down on the people who stare up at them, cameras flashing.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - July 2020: The Preservation Society
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Preservation Society is a group that has become widespread in the late days of the outbreak. They adhere to their mission statement unwaveringly - the cultivation and preservation of human knowledge. There are many conflicting views as to the origins of the group, but generally it is believed that sometime after the foundations of civilization began to crumble a marginal band of survivors decided that they would take it upon themselves to carry this burden. Over time and periodic interactions with other groups over the coming days their numbers would grow. Associations within the Society are loose at best with no true central hub, rather consisting as a conglomeration of disparate groups which may or may not have good means of communicating with others who share their banner. It also means one group claiming membership to The Preservation Society may behave and interact with other survivors in very different ways leaving them spoken about like some disjointed myth that one might actually encounter. If someone could step up and begin working to unite these various sub-groups then they might well be able to start actually making some real headway into
preserving human knowledge on a large scale.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - September 2020: Miss Hollow Eyes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Nobody knows what the little girl’s name is, but she hasn’t aged a day since she’s lived at the orphanage. Teased for the dark circles under her eyes, the other kids called her Miss Hollow Eyes, even though they teased her out of fear. Every single family who has attempted to adopt her has died in some mysterious way, they were all found separately in different rooms. Several times the orphanage has attempted to to throw her out, but she just waited on the front door until she was let back in, days, in some cases weeks later. She doesn’t eat, she doesn’t sleep, and nobody has ever heard her speak...not once.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - October 2020: Out of the Ashes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A request made by our fans was that we demonstrate a walkthrough from start to finish of a scenario of Outbreak: Undead... This is no simple task, not because it can’t be done, but because there is a range of details that a GM is generally prepared to ignore in what is designed ultimately as a survival simulator. For this reason, what a GM wishes to ignore or focus on for their own scenarios makes the full range of possible detail a bit of a conundrum, since not every game needs to be structured with this hardcore an approach to running a session.

boardgame.name: Free Content Friday - November 2020: The Old Man and the Z Chapter 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This takes place in a region near an ocean in the Pacific Northwest. Rufus can be interacted with as part of any scenario based on that region, or his particular story can be played out in its entirety starting from Part 1.

boardgame.name: Overlight - Seeds of Berkhan - February 2020: The Leviathan Grand
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“We welcome our guests to the Leviathan Grand Resort, a limitless and mind-expanding destination that climbs like alabaster stairs down Ogemos’s luxurious sea cliffs. Our pampered patrons may select from two magnificent sides of the resort—the shimmering beaches and gardens of Goldside or the shaded grottos and iridescent tidal pools of Loraqua Caverns."

boardgame.name: Overlight - The Assassin Sarcholi Nunka - April 2020
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What lies within the mind of a man that serves the unknowable? If one can answer that question, you might begin to understand the will of Sarcholi Nunka, Skyborn and assassin.

boardgame.name: Overlight - The Red Wind Fighting Club - August 2020
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the cities across the shards, there will always be those who seek to take advantage of the weak-willed and desperate of pocket. Whether cults or criminal organizations, wherever there is money to be made—or power to be taken—there is always an evil sort preying upon the downtrodden and innocent.
